summary: This bill, the Maternal and Infant Syphilis Prevention Act (H.R. 3866), aims to address the rising rates of congenital syphilis in the United States. It directs the Secretary of Health and Human Services to issue guidance to state Medicaid and Children's Health Insurance Programs (CHIP) on best practices for screening, treatment, and education related to syphilis for pregnant women and newborns. The bill emphasizes strategies to improve access to testing, integrate telehealth, and increase awareness, including a report to Congress on implementation progress.
